column5: Making your money work for you
column6: Holding onto cash can be great but how can we invest it wisely? Think you are ready to survive the fluctuations in share prices or think you know how to process information easily? Not sure what options are out there?

There are numerous headlines of an upcoming recession but you have recently read in an analyst report that there are some rumours about foreign investment inflows for large infrastructure projects to curb against the recession.
column19: Recession worsens - foreign investment inflows are just a rumour
column20: The recession worsens and the foreign investment inflows have just been a speculation.
column23: Foreign investment inflows slightly reduce effects of the recession..
column24: Foreign investment inflows for large infrastructure investments helped to reduce the recession effects, however only a few sectors have benefited.

column5: Company ABC is facing a cash crunch
column6: After an unexpected loss in collections, recent reports show ABC is in hot water as they struggle to make payments to suppliers and have put a hold to bond dividend payouts. The company CEO announced that they are looking to resolve the issue through refinancing and hope to resolve the issue before the end of the month.
column19: Company ABC delays bond payments further
column20: ABC CEO has announced that they were unable to secure refinancing. They will be delaying their dividend payouts to debtors for the next few months. As such, the value of their bond issue has decreased due to the perceived increased risk on their ability to pay out.
column24: ABC CEO has announced that they were able to secure refinancing. Investors are relieved.

column4: U.S. Federal Reserve lowers interest rates
column5: Central banks globally get ready to cut rates..
column6: Anticipated U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and subsequent SIBOR rates expected to lower in the coming month. After a recent announcement by the US Federal Reserve, lower interest rates by the end of the month are anticipated. The exact interest rate change has not been specified, however the Chairman of the US Federal Reserve explained that the amount will be adjusted appropriately to tackle the challenging economic conditions ahead.
column19: The Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the first time in 12 years.
column20: Following the announcement of the Federal Reserve rate cuts, the Singapore bond market has responded with increased bond prices across the board pricing in the interest rate change.
column23: The Federal Reserve decides to withold from cutting interest rates
column24: The chairman of the US Ferderal Reserve announced today that after consulting with economic experts, cutting of interest rates is delayed until it is more appropriate to do so.

column4: U.S. Federal Reserve increases interest rates
column5: Rising Federal Reserve interest rates on the horizon..
column6: Experts anticipate that the FED it will likely increase interest rates in the coming month. This is to meet continued booming market conditions and Singapore bond holders should expect a drop in bond prices in the coming year.
column19: FED Increase interest rates, Singapore Bond market reacts
column20: Following the official annoucement by the chairman of the US Federal Reserve, bond prices have significantly decreased.
column23: The Federal Reserve decides not to increase interest rates
column24: The chairman of the US Ferderal Reserve announced today that after consulting with economic experts, increasing interest rates is delayed until it is more appropriate to do so.

column5: You fridge is making some weird noises
column6: Since last night, your fridge has a weird buzzing sound everytime you come near it. It is getting pretty old already, you are going to have to replace it soon but it might still last a few more months.
column20: Darn, it looks like it didnt manage to last till the end of the month. You need somewhere to store your groceries so the faster you replace it, the better. You purchase a new fridge with your remaining savings.
column24: After a month of the strange buzzing sounds, they suddenly disappeared. Hopefully it will last through another few months.

column5: Your start feeling a bit sick
column6: You start to feel light-headed at work, at first you thought it was a fever or just the lack of sleep. When checking for fever you find yourself perfectly fine. It could be nothing but you decide to see the doctor at the end of the month just to be sure.
column20: After feeling a bit down for a few weeks you decide to check with your doctor. He mentions that you have a serious illness affectng your bloods ability to carry oxygen. It is not uncommon but he prescribes some medication for you to take regularly in order to fight the symptoms. Usually this sort of medication would be covered by insurance but you need to check if you have any. Otherwise you will have to cover it every month.
column24: After visiting the doctor, he informs you that its just a small flu. He gives you some medication and after some days of rest you should be fine.

column6: While having dinner, you see a pool of water on the floor. You decide to open the cupboard and find the sink pipe leaking slightly. You decide to put some tape over it to hold it for now. It might be time to call a plumber soon.
column20: What a tragedy, it seems that the sink pipe was clogged and the whole thing came apart spilling water everywhere. It was not too bad but now the floor is drenched and need to replace the pipe.
column24: You open the cabinet again at the end of the month to finally check on the pipe again. After tightening the pipe slightly with a wrench and some pipe tape, it is as good as new.

column5: It is about time for a pay raise
column6: After working on a long project, you ask your boss for a small bump in salary. He agreed and it seems the company was impressed of your hard work and innovative mindset and wants to keep you around but your boss needs to check with HR. The raise will be announced at the end of the month.
column20: At the end of the month, your boss comes to you with a smile and says you got the raise. Expect your next few months salary to increase.
column23: You did not get the raise
column24: Unfortunately after talking to HR, your boss informs you that you would not be able to secure the raise due to budget cuts for the department.

column6: After a series of unfortunate events, your boss is extremely angry at a botched project. It seems that the client was very unhappy with the result and filed a formal complaint against your team. With the economy the way it is, the company is looking to reduce headcount. This makes things a lot worse. It might be time to consider looking for a new job or save up some spare cash just in case it takes awhile.
column20: After a recent meeting, your boss tells you that unfortunately they have to let you go and you have till the end of the month to pack your things.
column24: After a long meeting with HR, your boss decides that your previous work has warranted you to stay with the company. He will overlook this recent project due to the events that caused it to fail. You get to keep your job!

column4: Company offers premium buyback of bonds issued
column5: ABC announces it will purchase bonds back at a premium
column6: After an unexpected loss in collections, recent reports show ABC in hot water as they struggle to make payments to suppliers and uphold bond payments. The companys CEO announced that they are looking to resolve the issue through refinancing and hope to resolve the issue before the end of the month.
column20: ABC officially announced that they will not be recalling the bonds anymore, leaving those with bonds left to trade on the free market.

column5: Risky market for ABC and credit rating agencies are taking notice
column6: After a bad series of events, the ABC market seems to be struggling to stay profitable. Recent credit rating agencies have thus discussed reducing the credit rating of ABC bonds from AAA to AA+. However, this will largely depend on the market census released at the end of the month. Bond prices have slightly reduced in anticipation for the up-coming change in credit ratings.
column20: After a review, the credit rating agencies have decided to follow through and reduce the credit rating of ABC bonds. The bond market has reacted as well, reducing the price of ABC bonds.
column24: The credit rating agencies have decided to delay any change in credit ratings until future months.

column5: The market for ABC maintains strong growth
column6: After recent months of volatility, the market for ABC seems to be showing some stability and steady increase. Credit rating agencies are debating on increasing the credit rating for ABC from AA+ to AAA. This security is a welcomed change and the bond market has reacted postively to the recent news. The credit rating agencies are waiting till the end of the month to decide if they should or should not proceed with the change in credit rating.
column20: After a review, the credit rating agencies have decided to follow through and increase the credit rating of ABC bonds. The bond market has reacted as well, increasing the price of ABCs bonds.
column24: The credit rating agencies have decided to delay any change in credit ratings until future months.

column6: ABC banks' anti money-laundering unit has been accused of insufficient controls in the recent 1MDB scandal, investors are losing confidence in the stocks.
column20: ABC bank gets fined by the regulator by USD $10 million.
column24: The regulator decides that the anti money laundering scandal requires further investigation and is currently withholding from fines

column6: ABC project Copernicus, one of its key projects for this financial year, had the objective to establish the largest organic food megafarm in South East Asia. It been cancelled due to wrong valuation estimates of investments required. Sunk costs have already been incurred. 10% of the total project sum is unrecoverable.
column20: Further investigations have shown that the wrong valuation estimates could have been prevented by getting a second opinion which is standard procedure. However, the executive responsible for the project had decided to withhold from that to save costs as he had personal relations with the other valuation firm. Employees and shareholders are outraged, request to dismiss the executive and a majority is pulling out their current stocks holdings in the firm.
column24: Investigations on the case have not shown any misconduct yet. The investigation is still in progress, key shareholders remain skeptic and expect more news to be revealed soon.

column6: ABC has delayed its partnership negotiations with XYZ due to discrepancy in shareholder opinions. The deal is expeced to be delayed by 3 months.
column19: Partner pulls out of the deal
column20: The partnership negotiatons fail as the partner pulls out of the deal
column23: Majority of shareholders are more interested in another deal partner
column24: The majority of shareholders remain hopeful. They are more interested to see a deal go through with an alternative partner that is much more promising.

column6: After aquiring XYZ, ABC has been suprised by unreported damaged inventory that needs to be written off its balance sheet, reducing its total assets. Shareholders are outraged as XYZ has claimed state of the art manufacturing equipment which was one of the main reasons of the aquisition.
column20: It turns out that the 3rd party that has conducted the due diligence has only tested a small sample fraction instead of all machinery due to time pressure of the acqusition. Shareholders are outraged.
column24: The machinery could partly be fixed but some of it is unrecoverable. Some investors are not happy, others remain hopeful.

column6: One of ABCs key suppliers, supplying one of the most critical parts in its value chain has defaulted. ABC needs to find a replacement quickly but has already received 6 proposals of companies with an equivalent profile. Due diligence is still being conducted if the suppliers can ensure to keep up with ABCs volume required, as ABC is encountering 10% annual growth.
column20: The defaulted supplier cannot recover and ABC did not source an alternative one in time to satisfy demand. Shareholders are dumping the stocks.
column24: A Private Equity firm has put down a considerable sum to conduct a leveraged buyout on the supplier to enable the supplier to operate further. The PE firm is looking at stabilizing cash flows and ensuring a solid fundament for growth. As a result, Ultimately, ABC only suffers from a 1 week delay in its supply chain.

column6: High volatility in the markets and investor speculations have caused emotionally driven trading on the markets
column20: Some investors have acted too fast and have traded based on market emotions. Some smart traders have used this as an arbitrage opportunity and have highly benefited. Investors realize that volatility was driven merely by speculation and false news and are investing back into the market.
column24: Investors realise that they have been trading on emotions. They are adjusting their trades causing the market to correct closer back to its norm.

column6: ABCs employees are protesting after multiple promises of firm-wide wage increases that have not materialised yet
column20: ABC has announced that it will increase firm-wide wages by 5% across all critical business functions and employees return to work.
column24: ABCs management board is still in conflict with shareholders as returns promised this year will not be achieved due to firm-wage wage increases. A large part of the short-term shareholders decide to sell the stocks.

column6: ABCs projected company growth announced this week is 2% below shareholder expectations.
column19: The economy is in a recession
column20: After checking with friends and your trusted wealth manager you realise that the economy is actually in a recession, the government just announced this publicly and you should have spoken to your wealth manager earlier to verify.
column23: Lower earnings caused through supplier shortfall has been rectified
column24: ABC reasoned that the growth numbers were affected through a shortfall in supplier components last month which has now been rectified, the company shipped all pending orders and continues on its growth path.

column6: A friend of you who is also holding ABC stocks has received some insider information that sales are currently not as good as expected by shareholders, but he is not really sure what to do with his own stocks as well.
column19: Your friend was right but his estimates were off
column20: It turns out that your friends rumour was true but it was not as bad as expected, luckily you have done some research and have found out that the poor earnings were just temporary.
column23: Your friend has received false information
column24: It turns out that your friends hot tip has just been a rumor

column6: ABC is currently in discussions of down-scaling its current operations and selling off some of its non-core business to an interested competitor
column19: ABCs earnings are stronger than before
column20: It turns out that selling off the non-core business was a good decision and ABC has been able to utilize its resources more efficiently resulting in increased earnings.
column23: The acquiring company has delayed the negotiations
column24: The aquiring company has delayed negotiations but investors remain hopeful that the deal will be sealed soon.

column5: Fail in co-venture with Thai conglomerate
column6: ABC failed to co-venture with a promising Thai conglomorate that it has high syngergies with.
column24: Investors at the last shareholder meeting agree that the failed co-venture has hurt ABCs growth prospects but are willing to look for another potential party to co-venture with.

column6: A temporary oil shortage announced by several oil-sheiks in Saudi Arabia has increased oil prices and in turn ABCs operating cost significantly.
column20: Oil prices have increased by 30% and ABC is getting into trouble to keep production cost below revenue gained per product, the situation seems to endure for a longer period of time.
column23: Oil prices are back to normal
column24: Oil prices are back to normal as other OPEC countries have announced to make up for the shortage in Saudi Arabias oil supply to keep global prices stable.

column5: Government corporate tax raise in Singapore
column6: The government has raised corporate tax rates by 2.5%
column19: Corporate tax rate affects the whole economy - ABC has sufficient buffer
column20: The increased corporate tax rate affects the whole economy, overall shareholders are therefore unconcerned and ABC had safety measures in place to buffer against sudden market changes or government annoucements regarding tax.
column24: ABC has not anticipated the sudden tax change and does not have adequate funds to buffer against this rise in taxes. The company needs to take up a temporary loan to operate further effectively.

column5: Earnings estimates are off the charts
column6: ABC is beating earnings estimates previously predicted by analysts
column20: ABCs earnings continue to rise and shareholders increase their holdings as they expect this path to continue for the year ahead.
column24: ABCs earnings stay stable, however the positive earnings still increase investor confidence and attract more shareholders to the stocks.

column5: Record sales booked in the pocket
column6: ABCs growth is higher than expected, record sales have been achieved in key growth markets such as China and India.
column20: ABC continues to encounter record sales in its key growth markets and investors are looking positively towards ABCs future earnings.
column24: ABCs sales are predicted to slightly decrease for the coming months but are still higher than expected.

column6: The government has just announced that the corporate tax rate will be decreased by 2.5%
column19: Corporate tax rate affects the whole economy - everyone benefits
column20: The increased corporate tax rate benefits the whole economy.
column23: Tax rate reduction enables ABC to pay off high interest loans on its balance sheet
column24: The tax deduction has enabled ABC to pay off some of its high interest loans and has resulted in higher retained earnings that can be returned to shareholders.

column6: Emerging markets are booming and ABC has entered several promising markets over the years
column19: ABC has increased investments and emerging market growth continues
column20: Increased investments have enabled ABC to reap even more profits through key operations in emerging markets.
column23: Emerging markets growth continues, further investments are too slow
column24: ABC has failed to take on the opportunity quickly enough to increase its stakes and increase its investments to expand operations within key emerging markets it is operating in, ABC is still highly benefiting regardless.

column5: Cash surplus due to solid sales
column6: A cash surplus has been announced through a year of solid sales within high margin markets ABC is operating in
column20: The cash surplus has increased investor confidence and hopes are high that ABC will stay on its current path
column24: The surplus announced is negligible, most investors have decided to keep their holdings constant.

column6: ABCs aquired ventures have been contributing to successful company growth, the aquisitions have been requested through shareholders over a longer period of time and are finally materialising.
column19: Sales increase + record influx of investments
column20: ABCs aquisiton has been the best decision the company has taken in years, sales increase and investors are positively looking towards the future, the company and its shareholders anticipate strong growth in the future.
column24: Even though the co-venture has been successful, sales continue to rise moderately. Shareholders are still satisfied.

column5: Further expansion into Asia and Africa
column6: ABC is spending its retained earnings to continue its expansion at existing locations and into new markets within Asia and Africa.
column20: ABCs stocks is trending. The companies expansion makes investors hopeful of even more profits in the future and there is increased demand for the stocks to support ABCs expansion plans, however investors are still unsure if the expansion will be successful.
column24: Even though expansion plans have been announced and there is some degree of positive outlook for the future, investors are still skeptic if the expansion is targeting the right markets.

column6: ABCs sales figures on one of its core products have increased by 30%
column20: Sales figures for ABCs core product keep increasing steadily, investors gain increased confidence that this trend will continue.
column23: Sales figures increasing, however possibly a hype..
column24: Sales figures kept increasing for ABCs core product, however investors view it as a current hype that might level off at some point. Confidence remains high.

column6: Halfway through your work, your computer starts glitching. It could be that weird popup the other day but you do not really know. Soon you are greeted with a blue screen with a warning message. Rebooting was useless and it seems like it might be time to get a new computer. However,first you got to see if you can get it repaired. The repair shop tells you they will take about a month to look into the issue as it seems like a serious crash.
column20: After you visit the repair shop again. They tell you that they managed to fix it but charge you a hefty fee for the services they provided
column23: Looks like you need a new computer
column24: After awhile, the repair shop gets back to you and unfortunately they were not able to fix the computer. They do not charge you anything than the initial fee but you will need to get a new computer all together

column6: While washing your hands, your handphone slipped into the sink on accident while the tap was running. In a panic, you grabbed it but dropped it on the floor and the phone turned off. Although you tried some internet tricks, it seems you are going to have to bring it to the repair shop in order to repair it. They tell you the damage is pretty bad but they can try to replace the parts. Hopefully it will be cheaper than having to buy a new one
column20: After you visit the repair shop again. They tell you that they managed to fix it but charge you a hefty fee for the services they provided
column23: Looks like its time for a new phone
column24: After awhile, the repair shop gets back to you and unfortunately they were not able to fix the phone. They do not charge you anything than the initial fee but you will need to get a new computer all together

column6: After flushing the toilet, you hear a weird gurgle sound and the water does not seem to be refilling. Concerned you call a plumber and he comes over to fix the pipes. He gets the toilet working again but he says you might want to be careful because the pipes seem old and rusted. You might have the same problem again in the future. He said he can come and check again in a month to let you know if the fix has worked or if you will need to replace the whole piping system.
column20: Unfortunately, the toilet acts up again but this time gets worse. It starts to flood the bathroom when you tried to flush again. You call the plumber and he tells you that your pipes have been very badly clogged. He comes over to fix the issue and stops the flooding but he needs to unclog and replaces the pipes to prevent it from having any further issues.
column24: The plumber checks back again after a month. You let him know there have been no issues since that time.

column6: One night while watching TV, you hear a pop sound before the lights and TV go off. Climbing in the dark you see that the circuit had blown. You call an electrician and he says he will come by in the morning to fix it. The next morning he arrives and inspects the issue. He tells you that it could be some faulty wiring in the house since its old and might have to replace it. He resets the fuse and tells you to inform him if it happens again.
column20: After a month the fuse is tripped again and everything turns off. You call the electrician again and he tells you he will have to replace the wiring in the walls. Seems that something is causing the trip. The replacement is costly as he will have to open the wall to reach the wiring.
column24: After a month, there does not seem to be any issue with the wiring. Hopefully it will be fine for the rest of the year.
